results.title: Baroque dance 1675-1725 (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The dance which evolved to perfection within the French Academy though called ‘Baroque’, shares attributes with French classicism. Presents the dance within the visual context of the period showing the consistency in concept with other arts of the time. No other credits available.

results.title: Barnum (Musical)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Harold Fielding and Terry Hughes
results.brief_description: The stage production starring Michael Crawford of ‘Barnum!’ recorded in 1986 when the hit circus musical was performed at the Victoria Palace in London’s West End. The story traces Phineas Taylor Barnum’s colourful career during 1835 to 1881, from his beginnings as a promoter of sideshows to the pinnacle of his success after he joined James A. Bailey to form the circus which was known as ‘The Greatest Show on Earth’. Featuring 14 musical numbers with music by Cy Coleman and lyrics by Michael Stewart. Original Broadway production directed by Joe Layton, the production cast also includes Christine Collier, Sharon Benson and Eileen Battye.

results.title: Barnum
results.creator_credit: Filmline International, Robert Halmi Productions, Ira Halberst, David J. Patterson and Lee Philips
results.brief_description: Made-for-television film that chronicles the life of 19th-century American showman and circus operator Phineas T. Barnum. Beginning in 1883 with an eager audience awaiting the opening of Barnum & Bailey’s “Greatest Show on Earth,” the film flashes foward to an elderly Barnum, then back, as he recalls his life story from his early days in New England to his time as a freak-show hustler and his ultimate triumph as a big time impressario. Barnum’s famous motto was, “give them entertainment and let them enjoy themselves.” A stage-musical version of Barnum’s story made in 1986 is also held in the collection.

results.title: Bargemen on the Rhine
results.brief_description: Shows how barges move along the Rhine carrying goods and produce. Details the operation and servicing and life aboard a modern tug. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Bargain basement
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor, James de B. Domville and John Smith
results.brief_description: This fictional film focuses on the unexpected confrontation of an experienced shoplifter and a lonely store detective. She lifts one time too many, and he suggests they “talk it over” - in his apartment! Desperation drives people into strange situations. When finally they part, neither one of them will ever be quite the same again. Original story by Douglas Bowie. Starring Vladimir Valenta and Luce Guilbeault. Awards: Toronto; Mannheim; New York.

results.title: Barefoot student army
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, Lyndal Barry, Sophie Barry, John Moore and Catherine Marciniak
results.brief_description: In March 1988, Burmese students took to the streets in the capital Rangoon as a protest against the oppressive rule of Prime Minister Ne Win. Ten thousand protesters were killed in what was perceived to be a typical response by Government forces. Many students, fighting for survival, fled into the jungle in order to find freedom. Sophie and Lyndall Barry, two young Melbourne film makers, intended to stay only a matter of days, but remained for a year recording the plight of these students on the Thai/Burma border. A compelling documentary providing insight into one of the politically sensitive regions of Asia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Open Channel Productions, Lyndal Barry, Sophie Barry, John Moore and Catherine Marciniak

results.title: Barefoot adventure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Brown Films and Bruce Brown
results.brief_description: This re-construction by the maker of “Endless Summer” (1966), of his third surfing film (originally released in 1960), features footage taken at some of the best longboarding beaches in Hawaii and California. Bruce Brown, developed the surf film genre (which originated in Australia) by adding a slight narrative line and a light-hearted commentary. From the late fifties to the early seventies Brown made nine surfing films which he roadshowed across America, screening them in local halls, theatres and school auditoriums, and providing live improvised commentary. The soundtrack for this and a number of Brown’s other surf films were composed by jazz legend Bud Shank and performed with his quartet.

results.title: Barefoot
results.creator_credit: Concordia Films, Stan Hersh, Melvin Hersh and C B Wismar
results.brief_description: Worn down on his luck, a frustrated salesman makes his rounds in the noise of the city. He is suddenly surrounded by children who turn his day inside out leaving him free of inhibitions and anger and appreciating life more.

results.title: Bare [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Wild Iris Productions, Liz Baulch and Deborah Strutt
results.brief_description: There are misunderstandings aplenty in this award-winning Australian short when two gay boys accidentally catch their lesbian neighbours in an early morning clinch. High density living in all its revealing glory. Cast includes Madeleine Swain, Maria Theodorakis, Luke Elliot, David Treddinick and Esme Melville.
